range: Transcaucasus, Afghanistan to China to Philippines (Luzon)
source: Mém. Acad. Imp. Sci. St.-Pétersbourg Divers Savans 2: 89 (1835)
desc: The Chinese pistache, a member of the cashew family, is the most-planted street tree in Fremont due to its hardiness and vibrant foliage. Though related to the pistachio tree (Pistacia vera), its berries are not edible.
